Delivery Manager

Company Name Reserve Bank of Australia Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Assist in the delivery of key project - ROBAS
  • Relationship focused position \xa0
  • 12 month contract, Sydney CBD Location

The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system. Those who are involved in the activities of the Bank have an important role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting role.


We are currently looking for a Delivery Manager to join our IT team and lead the integrated management and delivery of a group of related projects. In this role supporting ROBAS, you will manage the relationships between the business and technical stakeholders during the implementation of business change and throughout the Project lifecycle to ensure business satisfaction.


This role will also see you manage the team resources to ensure that they are properly utilised and are able to reach their potential while leading the business engagement process for new initiatives.

Desired Skills and Experience

What are we looking for?


  • An ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
  • A Project Management Certification and extensive knowledge of Agile project management methodologies and practices
  • An understanding of banking and payment systems, services and operations.
  • The ability to articulate technology benefit in terms of business functions.
  • Knowledge of a Solution Delivery Lifecycle (SDLC).
  • Experience in managing a team of IT Professionals to deliver business change on time and budget.

In return, we offer you an opportunity where you can be part of a team with real opportunities to grow your career in an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people. You will also have access to excellent benefits!


Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.\xa0 A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.


The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.\xa0 We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Contact the job poster

Jessica Stamedes

Senior Consultant, Talent Acquisition at Reserve Bank of Australia

Senior Academic Governance Officer

Company Name Study Group Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Study Group is one of the world’s largest international education and training organisations. Every year over 70,000 students from more than 130 countries choose to study with Study Group. We invest in international students’ futures and enhance their prospects by focusing on the way they learn as well as the qualifications they achieve. In Australia, we deliver a wide range of pathway, higher education, vocational and English language programs for students from all over the world.

\xa0

We are currently seeking two staff experienced in Academic Governance Support to provide professional secretariat and project coordination services to the governing boards and committees of the University Partnerships and Higher Education Operations of Study Group ANZ, and the Head of Academic Quality Assurance and Governance.

Senior Academic Governance Officer

Role Type: Ongoing, full time role, based in Sydney.

Salary Range: Approx. $85,000 per annum (+ superannuation)


The position is responsible for

  • Managing and conducting a comprehensive secretariat service that effectively supports a large case load of Board/Committee meetings, including preparation of meeting agenda, thorough minute taking, and assisting with the implementation of meeting resolutions.
  • Accurately maintaining Governance and Committee information including registers, policies, procedures and associated documents including those required under legislation.
  • Contributing to the successful operation of the Academic Quality Assurance and Governance Office through the application of professional senior project coordination skills; student performance, survey and quality indicators data collation and reporting skills; administrative support skills; and stakeholder liaison/communication skills.

\xa0

Experience, Skills and Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2-years of relevant secretariat servicing experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in providing Board and/or committee secretariat services in a tertiary education or equivalent public/private sector setting, including minute taking.
  • Experience in maintaining governance and committee information including registers, policies, procedures and associated documents including those required under legislation.
  • Experience in the preparation of business reports and other written documentation
  • High level verbal and written communication skills.
  • Advanced skills with software packages, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet, email, calendar and electronic document management systems.
  • Ability to coordinate and undertake research and prepare correspondence, statistical and qualitative reports, and other written documentation.
  • Ability to apply a high level of confidentiality and sensitivity to a range of business matters.
  • Advanced organisation and self-management skills including the ability to effectively prioritise duties to meet deadlines, with professionalism and maintain consistent high standards.
  • Ability to work effectively individually and as a member of a geographically dispersed team.
  • Ability to negotiate and resolve conflict constructively, work in a tactful and diplomatic manner and respond appropriately when dealing with sensitive matters.
  • General understanding of the role and function of governance and committee processes in a highly regulated organisational context.
  • Knowledge of legislation relevant to High School, Foundation, ELICOS, Higher Education and/or CRICOS education providers.


To apply, please email your application to Jill Woodruff, Head of Academic Quality Assurance and Governance, SGA JWoodruff@studygroup.com

Contact the job poster

Gemma Barber

Global Talent Acquisition at Study Group

Brisbane, Australia

Project Manager, Traceability

Company Name Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability.

The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds.

The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

PROJECT MANAGER - TRACEABILITY

  • $116,863 - $156,387 (Plus Superannuation)
  • Fixed Term – 2 YEARS
  • Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
  • Usual work location: Attwood (flexibility may be available)

The position of Project Manager - Traceability forms a part of the Agriculture Victoria division, Biosecurity and Agriculture branch within the Employment, Investment and Trade group.

The Employment, Investment and Trade Group delivers programs and services to grow the Victorian economy. Its focus is on creating jobs and raising incomes through industry development, targeted investment and increasing the export value of Victorian firms.

Reporting to the Director Biosecurity Operations, you will lead the implementation of key traceability programs, projects and initiatives within the Biosecurity and Agriculture Services branch (BAS).

To be successful in this role, you will have highly developed interpersonal, conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills. Experience leading complex projects in a government context and at all stages as well as demonstrated high level written communication skills and the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively are a must. A relevant tertiary degree and/or experience in developing projects related to biosecurity, product integrity and traceability will be well regarded.

For a confidential discussion, please call Michael Rosier on 03 9217 4314.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description. To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.

Applications close at midnight on 26th September 2018 and must address the Key Selection Criteria outlined in the Position Description.

Solar PV Project Manager

Company Name Service Stream Company Location Arndell Park, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Details

About The Role

Service Stream's Energy & Water business unit are seeking an experienced Solar PV Project Manager to work on our renewable energy contracts. Based out of our Arndell Park (NSW) office, and reporting into the General Manager, the role will be offered on a full time permanent basis. As the Solar PV Project Manager, you will provide project management services to assist the project delivery of roof and ground mounted installations, and ensure all operational activities across the businesses are efficient and effective.

Key Responsibilities

Your engineering or electrical trade background will be utilised to ensure project specifications are executed appropriately onsite and that all inspection, testing and commissioning requirements are carried out according to our procedures and in a timely manner. Furthermore, your engineering background will be drawn upon to ensure new product specifications are adequately reviewed and maintained.
  • Overall accountability for the KPI's for engineering, procurement, installation and commissioning of assigned projects. This will include maintaining the company's project management systems, coordinating in house and in-field teams and taking responsibility for all procedural and administration documentation
  • Keep clients abreast of project progress throughout the entire project delivery process
  • Maintain project management systems and budgets
  • Raise work orders for installation and logistics services associated with projects
  • Work with external consultants to deliver approval and planning documentation
  • Ensure all WHS practices are complied with by installation teams and staff on project sites
  • Assist with contractor negotiations
  • Work with the procurement team to ensure materials are ordered and delivered to site to meet the construction schedule
  • Maintain accurate project scheduling information in the BMS
  • Assist in the production of new policies and procedures
  • Assist in the internal audit process
  • Manage the equipment registers
  • Maintain an energetic and enthusiastic approach to motivate the team to achieve above expectations
  • Capability development for transfer of knowledge to sub-consultants, and design subcontractors, including training and development
  • Specialist design team mobilisation, including internal staff and external specialists
  • Assist staff with training "on the job" as required and one on one coaching and mentoring; and Establish and maintain a positive performance-based culture


Skills And Experience
  • Recognised degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical trade qualifications;
  • Minimum 1 year's prior project management experience within the solar PV industry
  • Expert knowledge of national and state regulations and guidelines in PV industry
  • Ideally CEC accreditation to design photovoltaic systems
  • White Card (or general construction induction card)
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Advanced knowledge and experience of MS Office


Benefits
  • Purchase additional annual leave
  • Kudos Reward and Recognition Program


How To Apply

If this sounds like the role for you, click 'APPLY' to submit your CV and cover letter.

 This role is part of Service Stream's Refer a Friend Program! If you wish to refer someone, please follow the Refer a Friend guidelines found on InStream (Intranet).

Job description

  • Paid on-the-job work experience
  • Cobar, NSW, Australia

CSA Mine is a high-grade underground copper mine located in Cobar, Central Western NSW.

We are currently recruiting for our Vacation Employment Program and are looking for enthusiastic tertiary students who are after the opportunity to gain valuable mining experience. As a Mining Engineer Vacation Student, your main objective will be to assist the engineering department in attaining weekly targets.

Responsibilities
  • Undertake site inspections and QA checks for all stopes before and after firings and coordinate site preparation work with the Senior Production Engineer
  • Ensure safe systems of work are incorporated into all tasks and work plans
  • Lead investigations into area responsible incidents
  • Contribute to the mines performance through the development of effective and efficient practical mining skills
  • Assist the Drill and Blast Engineer in developing stope drill and blast designs
  • Assist the Production Engineer in weekly planning
  • Provide engineering assistance as required
  • Any other task as directed by your Supervisor.


Requirements
  • Enrolled in Mining Engineering Degree
  • Previous exposure to underground mining operations (desirable)
  • Microsoft Office and computer literacy

Our program provides paid on-the-job work experience during your university vacation period, commencing the first week of December and ending the last week of February. Accommodation is provided.
